final_mappings.control_title: Ensure that the proxy kubeconfig file permissions are set to 644 or more restrictive

manual_review.why: Partial coverage - automated rules don't fully validate ensure that the proxy kubeconfig file permissions are set to 644 or more restrictive
procedure: SSH into each worker node or use kubectl exec with privileged container
Navigate to kubeconfig file location: /var/lib/kubelet/config.yaml
Execute: ls -la /var/lib/kubelet/config.yaml
Verify permissions are 644 or more restrictive (-rw-r--r--)
Verify ownership is root:root
Repeat for all worker nodes in the cluster
Document findings and take corrective action if needed
manual_review.acceptance_criteria: File permissions are 644 or more restrictive AND ownership is root:root for all kubeconfig files on all worker nodes

final_mappings.control_title: Ensure that the --read-only-port is disabled

manual_review.why: Partial coverage - automated rules don't fully validate ensure that the --read-only-port is disabled
procedure: SSH into each worker node or use kubectl exec with privileged container
Check kubelet configuration: cat /var/lib/kubelet/config.yaml | grep read-only-port
Verify --read-only-port is set to 0 or not present
Alternative: ps aux | grep kubelet | grep read-only-port
Verify the port is disabled (--read-only-port=0 or not present)
Repeat for all worker nodes in the cluster
Document findings and take corrective action if needed
manual_review.acceptance_criteria: --read-only-port is set to 0 or not present in kubelet configuration on all worker nodes

Verify the admission plugins include the required plugins (e.g., NodeRestriction)

Review the API server pod configuration for admission plugin settings
Document findings and take corrective action if needed
manual_review.acceptance_criteria: Required admission plugins are enabled and configured in API server configuration

Document findings and take corrective action if needed
manual_review.acceptance_criteria: Audit logging is properly configured with appropriate path, retention, and rotation settings in API server configuration

final_mappings.control_title: Ensure that the --bind-address argument is set to 127.0.0.1

manual_review.why: Partial coverage - automated rules don't fully validate ensure that the --bind-address argument is set to 127.0.0.1
procedure: Access the cluster with cluster admin privileges
Check API server configuration: kubectl cluster-info dump | grep bind-address
Verify --bind-address is set to 127.0.0.1
Alternative: Check API server manifest for bind address configuration
Review the specific component mentioned in the control (etcd, kube-scheduler, etc.)
Document findings and take corrective action if needed
manual_review.acceptance_criteria: --bind-address is set to 127.0.0.1 in the specified component configuration

final_mappings.control_title: Consider external secret storage

manual_review.why: External secret storage requires human judgment and decision making
procedure: Review current secret management implementation
Evaluate if external secret management solution is needed
Check if external secret provider is configured (e.g., HashiCorp Vault, AWS Secrets Manager, Azure Key Vault)
Verify authentication requirements for secret access
Confirm audit logging is enabled for secret access
Validate encryption is enabled for secrets
Check if secret rotation is implemented
Document findings and recommendations
manual_review.acceptance_criteria: External secret storage solution is properly configured with authentication, auditing, and encryption, OR decision is made that Kubernetes native secrets are sufficient
